content:
Yes, it's definitely possible to see wildlife during an archipelago cruise in Turku! The area is home to a variety of marine animals, including seals, porpoises, and occasionally even dolphins. The best chances to spot these animals would be during the summer months when the waters are warm, and the animals are more active.

Many of the archipelago cruises from Turku include stops at remote islands, which are also home to a wide variety of bird species, including eagles, ospreys, and cormorants. You might also spot a wide range of fish and other marine life in the clear waters of the archipelago.

Some of the best wildlife sightings happen when you take a guided tour with a naturalist who can help you identify and learn more about the wildlife you encounter. You can also check with the cruise company to see if they offer tours that are specifically focused on wildlife watching.
